stream_context.summary: Nearly the entire stream is devoted to importing, testing and iterating on a large batch of new or revised 3-D models and textures supplied by Biobak.  While Bowser’s office was announced as the goal, the session turns into a ‘model-replacement day’, touching everything from switches to enemies and particle effects, and repeatedly troubleshooting Fast64 quirks, texture combiners, collision and lighting.  Kaze also discovers floating-point crashes on real N64 hardware while capturing footage, highlighting the need for last-minute stability fixes.

development_findings.summary: Steel-beam textures in Bowser’s office are upgraded from CI4 (1-bit alpha) to an RGBA16 base texture plus a larger alpha mask, giving smoother edges without ‘crust’.
development_findings.quote: Because we now have 8-bit alpha the edges are much smoother and it looks so much better.

development_findings.summary: Blue-coin switch completely redesigned: star emblem on top, no ground-pound scale animation (5-frame original removed for snappier feel), stone SFX, collision resized and re-tuned.
development_findings.quote: A five-frame thing doesn’t need an animation – it would just feel slower.

development_findings.summary: Many levels crash on real N64 due to floating-point exceptions (e.g. Goomba scale hitting zero on crush).  Kaze flags this as a looming stability task before capture/release.
development_findings.quote: Unfortunately I found out that a lot of the levels have floating-point exceptions when you enter them right now on N64.

development_findings.summary: Cap switches overhauled: four new models (up, two in-between, down) with baked lighting; world-light integration achieved via vertex colours and revised combiner; vanilla scaling bone scrapped to avoid Fast64 armature bugs and speed up workflow.
development_findings.quote: That is so much faster than making the bones and avoids the jank completely.

development_findings.summary: Custom colour palette set for each cap type (red, cyan ice, cloud white, blue bomb).
Fish enemy remodelled (single CI4 sheet).  Constraint: one texture only so dozens can batch-render; Fast64 GL-layout bug forces manual pivot fix for fin.
development_findings.quote: Because we have so many fish, having an extra texture to load is going to be really, really bad.

development_findings.summary: New Goomba model accepted but closed-eye texture mapping breaks colour-swap logic; Kaze defers full integration and opens bug-tracker item.
development_findings.quote: We need the textures fixed – I’m not really sure what I can do here right now.

development_findings.summary: Ground-pound star sparkles redrawn to be rounder and less grainy; combiner glitch in plugin exposed and fixed after testing on NEMU and re-authoring combiner.
development_findings.quote: There must be a combiner setting somewhere that fucked it up – and I found it.

development_findings.summary: ‘Sludge Blarg’ boss block concept approved; uses metal beams for teeth and dual scrolling alpha textures; Kaze will code technical animation (damage colour shift etc.).
development_findings.quote: The beams and teeth is genius – Biobak deserves a medal for that.

development_findings.summary: Performance mindset: entire Course 1 now renders in ~26 ms; Kaze targets ~24.5 ms via micro-optimisations (texture batching, embedding pipes, etc.).
development_findings.quote: I think we can get it down to maybe 24.5 [ms].

context_findings.summary: Kaze actively studies MrBeast videos for audience engagement techniques.
context_findings.quote: I actually study MrBeast’s videos like a fucking nerd – how can I implement this?

context_findings.summary: Rant against C++ ‘private’ variables illustrates preference for low-level transparency and disdain for unnecessary abstractions.
context_findings.quote: Private variables don’t exist on the processor – why is it a thing in your code?

context_findings.summary: Expresses pride in shaving nanoseconds for the meme, reflecting obsession with technical optimisation.
context_findings.quote: At this point I’m just doing it for the meme – saving 50 nanoseconds.

context_findings.summary: Mentions changed workout routine (bench day shifted), revealing attempt at work-life balance amid streaming schedule.
Shows frustration but also humour toward Fast64 bugs, emulator quirks and chat ‘gaslighting’ about the day of the week.

biobak.summary: Supplied large batch of new models/textures (blue-coin switch, cap switches, fish, Goomba, coin texture, fire, 8-bit pipe, ‘sludge blarg’).
Actively collaborates in chat, accepts iterative tweaks (contrast, brightness, vertex colours) and quickly delivers requested adjustments.
biobak.quote: Okay, let me just do that real quick.

zeina.summary: Thwomp animation variations finished; Kaze plans to import after model pass.
zeina.quote: Did I send you the Thwomp animations? I am not sure.

key_stories.title: Reinventing the Blue-Coin Switch
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Biobak replace the notoriously ugly vanilla blue-coin switch.  Early concepts combine multiple designs, then Kaze prototypes real-time in Blender, debates animation vs. instant feedback, and finalises collision and sound.
key_stories.challenge: Vanilla model looked ‘dog shit’ and felt sluggish.
key_stories.process: Brainstorm in chat, combine star emblem idea, test scaling/removal, tweak vertex colours and collision.
key_stories.outcome: Crisp, modern blue-coin switch with no delay and proper stone SFX now in game.
key_stories.key_quote: Give me one vanilla Mario 64 model that is not awful.

key_stories.title: Cap-Switch Overhaul & Combiner Mystery
key_stories.summary: New cap-switch models needed to respect world lighting, but Fast64 and plugin bugs broke the combiner.  Kaze reverse-engineers the material pipeline, rebuilds the combiner from scratch, tests on NEMU and discovers a single wrong setting.
key_stories.challenge: Lighting and colour looked wrong and emulator crashed.
key_stories.process: Rip out bone animation, add intermediate models, experiment with vertex colours and primitive colour, debug on hardware and emulator, rebuild combiner.
key_stories.outcome: Fully lit, colour-correct cap switches with stable performance.
key_stories.key_quote: We can have our cake and eat it too – I know exactly what I’m doing here.

key_stories.title: Hardware Crashes Uncovered During Footage Capture
key_stories.summary: While recording N64 footage for a sign-tutorial video, Kaze discovers that some levels now crash due to floating-point errors (e.g., Goomba scaling).
key_stories.challenge: Unexpected N64 hard crashes jeopardise marketing video and final release.
key_stories.process: Reproduce on emulator, identify FPEs, note need to audit physics/math before shipping.
key_stories.outcome: Issue logged for upcoming bug-fix phase; NEMU debugger will be leveraged to speed up fixes.
key_stories.key_quote: A lot of the levels have floating-point exceptions – it’s going to be annoying as fuck.
